description: Returns an array of JobListEntry objects of the specified length. Each JobListEntry object is for a job in the specified cluster and contains a job's state, a job's ID, and other information.

parameters.name: ClusterId
parameters.description: The 39-character ID for the cluster that you want to list, for example CID123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000.

nested_items.name: JobListEntries
nested_items.description: Each JobListEntry object contains a job's state, a job's ID, and a value that indicates whether the job is a job part, in the case of export jobs.

nested_items.name: JobId
nested_items.description: The automatically generated ID for a job, for example JID123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000.

nested_items.name: JobState
nested_items.description: The current state of this job.

nested_items.name: IsMaster
nested_items.description: A value that indicates that this job is a main job. A main job represents a successful request to create an export job. Main jobs aren't associated with any Snowballs. Instead, each main job will have at least one job part, and each job part is associated with a Snowball. It might take some time before the job parts associated with a particular main job are listed, because they are created after the main job is created.

nested_items.name: SnowballType
nested_items.description: The type of device used with this job.

nested_items.name: CreationDate
nested_items.description: The creation date for this job.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The optional description of this specific job, for example Important Photos 2016-08-11.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: HTTP requests are stateless. If you use the automatically generated NextToken value in your next ListClusterJobsResult call, your list of returned jobs will start from this point in the array.
